name: CreatePullRequest
description: Automatically create a Pull Request for Azure DevOps or GitHub repository from Build or Release pipeline, supports also multi target branch.
author: Shayki Abramczyk

inputs.name: repoType
inputs.label: Git repository type
inputs.helpMarkDown: Choose the git repository type, Azure DevOps (Azure Repos) or GitHub

inputs.name: githubEndpoint
inputs.label: GitHub Connection (authorized with PAT)
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Select the service endpoint for your GitHub connection, must be authorized with PAT.
To create one, click the Manage link and create a new service endpoint.

inputs.name: repositorySelector
inputs.label: Repository to use
inputs.helpMarkDown: The method for selecting the Git repository. `Current build` will use the repository for which the current build is configured. `Select` will allow you to select an Azure Repository from your account.

inputs.name: githubRepository
inputs.label: Repository to use
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of the GitHub repository

inputs.name: projectId
inputs.label: Project
inputs.helpMarkDown: Project that contains the git repository you want to create a pull request for.

inputs.name: gitRepositoryId
inputs.label: Repository
inputs.helpMarkDown: Git repository you want to create a pull request for

inputs.name: isForked
inputs.label: Is Forked Repository
inputs.helpMarkDown: If checked, it means the source branch it from a forked repository and not from the original. the target repo will be the currnet build repo.

inputs.name: sourceBranch
inputs.label: Source branch name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The branch name that will be merged (for example - feature). the default is '$(Build.SourceBranch)'.

inputs.name: targetBranch
inputs.label: Target(s) branch name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The target branch name (for example - master). Also supports multi target branch with * (for example: test/*).

inputs.name: title
inputs.label: Title
inputs.helpMarkDown: The pull request title. You can use the token [BRANCH_NAME] to dynamically reuse the current target branch name in the pull request title (for example: Merge master into [BRANCH_NAME]).

inputs.name: description
inputs.label: Description
inputs.helpMarkDown: The pull request description (optional).

inputs.name: reviewers
inputs.label: Reviewers (Azure DevOps: email address or team name, GitHub: username)
inputs.helpMarkDown:
The pull request reviewers (optional).
For Azure DevOps - one or more email address or team name separated by semicolon. for example: test@test.com;MyTeamName
To make the reviewer required add 'req:', for example: 'req:test@test.com'
For GitHub - one or more usernames separated by semicolon. for example: username1;username2

inputs.name: tags
inputs.label: Tags
inputs.helpMarkDown: Pull request tags (optional). tags list separated by semicolon. for example: tag1;tag2

inputs.name: isDraft
inputs.label: Create Draft Pull Request
inputs.helpMarkDown:
If checked, the pull request will be a Draft Pull Request.
For Azure DevOps: see [here](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/devops/repos/git/pull-requests?view=azure-devops#draft-pull-requests) more info.
For GitHub: see [here](https://github.blog/2019-02-14-introducing-draft-pull-requests/) more info.

inputs.name: linkWorkItems
inputs.label: Link Work Items
inputs.helpMarkDown: If checked, all the work items that linked to the commits will be linked also to the PullRequest.

inputs.name: passPullRequestIdBackToADO
inputs.label: Pass Pull Request ID back to Azure DevOps as a variable
inputs.helpMarkDown: If checked, the Pull Request ID will be passed back to Azure DevOps for use in other pipeline tasks.  The variable can be referenced as '$(pullRequestId)'.  Note the value will be a semicolon-separated list of IDs if multiple target branches are specified (e.g. 'feature/*' or 'branch1;branch2;branch3' )

inputs.name: autoComplete
inputs.label: Set Auto Complete
inputs.helpMarkDown: If checked the pull request will close once all branch policies are met.

inputs.name: mergeStrategy
inputs.label: Merge Strategy
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the strategy used to merge the pull request during completion, see [here](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/devops/pull-requests-with-rebase/) more info.

inputs.name: deleteSource
inputs.label: Delete Source Branch
inputs.helpMarkDown: If true, the source branch of the pull request will be deleted after completion.

inputs.name: commitMessage
inputs.label: Commit Message
inputs.helpMarkDown: If set, this will be used as the commit message of the merge commit.  If empty the default will be used.

inputs.name: transitionWorkItems
inputs.label: Complete Associated Work Items
inputs.helpMarkDown: If true, we will attempt to transition any work items linked to the pull request into the next logical state (i.e. Active -> Resolved).

inputs.name: bypassPolicy
inputs.label: Bypass Policy
inputs.helpMarkDown: If true, policies will be explicitly bypassed while the pull request is completed.

inputs.name: bypassReason
inputs.label: Bypass reason
inputs.helpMarkDown: If policies are bypassed, this reason is stored as to why bypass was used.

inputs.name: alwaysCreatePr
inputs.label: Always Create Pull Request
inputs.helpMarkDown: If checked, a Pull Request will always be created even if there a no changed files.
